subject: Re: My EVP & ITC experimentation systems tour
author: ourobouros2k2
full_text:
Today was the first run of the brown noise session, I ran for about 10
minutes, and upon review, there were some short contacts, one named
Mike interestingly advised "empty" when I asked what was in my left
hand (he was correct, the item was in my right hand, I simply
misspoke). Today's session was abbreviated, I had poor reception for
some reason, the .469 was doing great, but the .120 was only receiving
strongly in FM. On the surface I would say it was a success, I will
have to correlate more sessions with white and pink noise loops to
determine. 

On a more personal note, I find brown/red noise a heckuva lot easier
on the ears since most of the amplitude of the signal is at lower
frequency. Reminds me of a large, fast river as heard from a bank.

thanks,
Andy

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)"
<michaelcoletta@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Andy,
> 
> I have mostly worked with the white noise, when I insert any type 
> noise.  Lately I've been going "noiseless" and just letting the audio 
> snippets come through... but when I do use it, I like the white.
> 
> I guess because there is such a history with EVP and white noise.  
> They are like a team from way back.  So many EVP pioneers used it.
> 
> Good idea you have with the DVD and looping track.  Any way you can 
> insert the noise is helpful.
> I haven't used any brown or red... how is that working for you?
> 
> And thanks for the kind words...
> - Mike
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "ourobouros2k2" <ourobouros2k2@> 
> wrote:
> >
> > Mike, quick question...I have been experimenting with a multichannel
> > system inspired by your spiricomp system. Rather than adding the 
> white
> > noise at the computer recording stage, I have a standalone dvd 
> player
> > with a looping track. I have experimented with white and pink noise
> > tracks, but was just curious which you have had the most success 
> with.
> > I also made a brown/red noise track, and wondered if you had
> > experimented with that at all. 
> > 
> > Thanks in advance, you work has been very helpful in getting me
> > started down this road.
> > 
> > Thanks,
> > Andy
> > 
> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)"
> > <michaelcoletta@> wrote:
> > >
> > > For those who care to see... I've posted a quick 4 minute video 
> tour of 
> > > the EVP and ITC systems I use, with a quick explanation of their 
> setup.
> > > The video is at:
> > > http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gyQKmBXY1ig
> > > 
> > > Thanks...
> > > and have a super-natural paranormal day!
> > > - Mike Coletta
> > > http://www.ufomagazine.net
> > >
> >
>
